author: cowman4410
content: Also I hope someone who truly understands ETH 2.0 development threads can clarify my confusion. From my understanding, ETH 2.0 will introduce POS with all the scalability benefits vs POW. My understanding is that ETH 2.0 will implement Friendly Finality Gadget (FFG) not Correct By Construction (CBC). To call FFG a POS distributed consensus algorithm is stretching the truth and therefore over exaggerating ETH 2.0 scalability benefits (without Layer 2 that could be used with ETH 1.0 POW anyway). FFG is at the core POW with POS overlayed to achieve finality in epochs. It wont achieve any scalability because at it's core it is POW. CBC is true POS as implemented by the renegade Casper network. Isn't ETH 2.0 on this basis just propaganda and the whole Beacon/FFG thread is a waste of time. Please help my confusion.

author: djrtwo
content:
Eip 1011 (hybrid pow/pos using ffg dor finality) was deprecated in 2018

EIP 3675 describes how the beacon chain (who's consensus  is driven by ffg) will become the new pure pos consensus for ethereum mainnet

author: djrtwo
content:
PoS itself does not scale a blockchain 

But you can create a sharded blockchain easier with pos and pow to add scale

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> you can do these tests anyway without doing the "safe merge".

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Safe merge is in fact a very unsafe idea

author: m.kalinin
content: Right, we can run the Merge testnets with the mainnet data and we will likely do this. But the idea of such testnets isn't related to the Safe Merge idea

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: In The Safe Merge approach _multiple "merge" tests_ are more valuable as this better replicates the mainnet conditions.  _multiple "merge" tests_ in The Merge approach doesn't address the fact that once-in-a-lifetime The Merge approach is much more attractive for attackers than the attempt-until-success approach in The Safe Merge. One of the main motivations of The Safe Merge is to address the unknown factors (i.e. attacks that we do not know even exist), but feel free to read the full discussion, there are pros and cons as always.
